intro: Misanteca pittieri, commonly known as the Mexican bellflower, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Mexico. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. It thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and native plant landscapes. Due to habitat loss, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
